title: Report exposes culture of hazing and humiliation at Cape Cod police academy
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The East Falmouth Police Academy opened its doors in January.
By March, academy leadership had been suspended and all staff instructors temporarily removed.
The Municipal Police Training Committee hosted an unrelated training session in Andover in 2023.

title: Chunk of MBTA’s downtown concourse ceiling falls due to water damage

bullets: Local News “We thank the public for notifying the T about the station issue at Park Street earlier this week," the MBTA said.
A hole in the ceiling of the MBTA's Winter Street Concourse.
Molly Farrar/Boston.

m.

title: SNL’s Rachel Dratch shares sunrise performance by Yo-Yo Ma in Hanover, N.H.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Celebs “Sharing this moment of peace and beauty on the Connecticut River at sunrise,” Dratch wrote on Instagram.
An animated Ma laughs and jokes at the Community Music Center of Boston on June 16, 2022.

(Lane Turner/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas October 23, 2025 | 4:51 PM 1 minute to read SNL’s Rachel Dratch took to social media on Wednesday to share a stunning sunrise performance by acclaimed cellist Yo-Yo Ma in Hanover, New Hampshire.

title: How Salem rallied after the government shutdown closed bathrooms during its busy Halloween season
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel "Salem steps up time and time again—to protect our businesses, our visitors, and our residents.
" Costumed revelers celebrate Halloween Eve in Salem, Massachusetts, on October 30, 2024.

title: Mass. man facing 29 charges after alleged 5-month crime spree
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The 30-year-old is due back in court Monday.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A 30-year-old man is facing a slew of charges following a five-month crime spree, according to Webster police.

title: DA’s office asking residents to submit DNA samples to help solve 1993 murder
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The voluntary collection is in hopes of finding new investigative leads.
Holly Piirainen.
– HandoutThe Hampden District Attorney’s Office is hosting a voluntary DNA sample collection to potentially find new leads in a 1993 murder case.
